definitions.definition: A commissioned officer in an armed military organization, typically the highest rank before flag officer ranks (generals). It is generally found in armies, air forces or naval infantry (marines).
A military leader, distinct from the modern professional military rank.
An honorary civilian title bestowed by some southern US states, most commonly Kentucky; notably Colonel Sanders of KFC .
An informal title used to address an elderly man.
A form of address for an auctioneer, from the American Civil War practice of commanding officers organizing the public sale of seized goods.

main_definition: A commissioned officer in an armed military organization, typically the highest rank before flag officer ranks (generals). It is generally found in armies, air forces or naval infantry (marines).
secondary_definitions: ( historical ) A military leader, distinct from the modern professional military rank.
An honorary civilian title bestowed by some southern US states, most commonly Kentucky; notably Colonel Sanders of KFC .
( Southern US, dated ) An informal title used to address an elderly man.
( US ) A form of address for an auctioneer, from the American Civil War practice of commanding officers organizing the public sale of seized goods.
